A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
Are the critics getting paid to give this movie an artificially high rating?

This movie is good in isolation. It is not a good Star Wars movie.

I have several issues with this film but I will only mention two:

#1: I don't buy that Luke tried to kill Kylo Ren because Kylo was being tempted by the Dark Side. Luke faced a similar situation with Darth Vader but always had hope. Luke's character always sees the good in people. And now we are expected to believe that Luke has a completely new personality and new values? And for no apparent reason? It's an insult to his character. 

#2 I see that Disney is attempting to start over with a whole new set of characters. The Rebellion is reborn with a new group of people that we know very little about. It's an abrupt transition and in my opinion it's awkwardly late in the game to start over. I wanted to walk out of this movie feeling excited for the next one\, but instead I left feeling tired.

Hopefully the next one is better...
